Name:
La Malouine
HMS La Malouine
Builder: Smiths Dock Co. Ltd, Middlesbrough, England
Fate:
Seized by the Royal Navy, 3 July 1940
Scrapped at Gelliswick Bay, 22 May 1947
Propulsion:
Two fire tube boilers
one 4-cycle triple-expansion steam engine
2,750 hp (2,050 kW)
Range: 3,500 nautical miles (6,500 km; 4,000 mi) at 12 knots (22 km/h; 14 mph)
Armament:
1 × BL 4-inch (101.6 mm) Mk IX gun
1 × QF 2-pounder pom-pom
two .50-inch (12.7 mm) twin machine guns,
two .303-inch (7.7 mm) Lewis machine guns
two stern depth charge racks with 40 depth charges
